title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: The sleep-debt-tracker project is a web application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML that helps users track and manage their sleep debt. This project, tagged under 'typescript', allows users to monitor their sleep patterns, visualize their sleep debt over time, and potentially implement strategies to improve their sleep habits.

title: resume
description: This repository contains my resume, crafted using LaTeX for professional and clean presentation. It serves as a personal project showcasing skills and experience, leveraging the typesetting capabilities of TeX to ensure optimal formatting and readability.

title: next-voting
description: Next-Voting is a project built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to create a streamlined and modern voting application. This repository houses the codebase for managing and participating in various voting scenarios, focusing on user-friendly interfaces and secure data handling. Key topics explored include front-end development with modern web technologies and implementation of voting mechanisms.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a modern web application project built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It serves as a comprehensive dashboard template, showcasing best practices for front-end development with a focus on clean architecture, type safety, and responsive design. The repository provides a solid foundation for building data-rich dashboards and single-page applications.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This repository contains a project focused on map visualization, leveraging HTML for front-end presentation and Python for back-end data processing or generation. The project explores techniques for displaying geographic data in an interactive and informative manner, making it a valuable resource for learning about web-based mapping and data visualization principles.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that serves as a dynamic and collaborative idea board. It provides a platform for brainstorming, organizing, and prioritizing concepts within a team or individual setting, facilitating efficient project planning and development.

title: jovian
description: The `jovian` repository implements a CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) application using Python with the Flask framework, a PostgreSQL database, and a front-end built with HTML and CSS. This project demonstrates a practical implementation of a web application, covering key concepts such as database interaction, server-side logic, and user interface design, utilizing technologies commonly found in modern web development environments.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a web-based interface built with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS for visualizing and interacting with data from a Robofleet robotics system. Utilizing Python on the backend, this project aims to offer a comprehensive dashboard solution for monitoring robot status, managing tasks, and analyzing performance metrics related to the specified robotics project.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, HTML, and ViteJS that leverages Express.js to connect to the Gemini API. This repository showcases a practical implementation of the Gemini API within a modern web application, demonstrating how to build interactive experiences with large language models.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebook and Python, houses a collection of personal finance projects. It explores various financial concepts and tools through practical application, aiming to provide hands-on experience in managing and analyzing finances using Python. This includes budgeting, investment analysis, and potentially other financial modeling projects.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a Next.js project built with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Supabase for efficient tracking of IoT assets. This repository demonstrates a full-stack application using modern web technologies, providing a foundation for building robust and scalable asset management solutions.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a project showcasing a customizable and interactive event calendar built using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. This repository demonstrates front-end development techniques for creating dynamic user interfaces and managing event data within a web application. It serves as a practical example of a web-based calendar implementation, suitable for learning or adapting for various projects.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool designed to visualize and analyze ROS (Robot Operating System) log files, providing a user-friendly interface for debugging and understanding robot behavior. Built using a combination of JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, this project aims to simplify log analysis, making it easier to identify issues and improve ROS system performance. This repository focuses on a self-contained project showcasing these technologies.
